column4: Is there a repository from which I could get a newer version of wireless-tools package than the one that's default in Hoary?
why do you need newer tools? sure it's not your driver?
I had NetworkManager working in Warty. The key then was to upgrade wireless-tools. Now apt-get says I have newest version but the "radar" does not show up and can't use the wlan in Hoary
ah, NetworkManager, don't know about that one, I've tried to get it working but couldn't so gave up :)
have you found some other nice way to switch between wireless networks?
like on the fly?  not really, i usually do 'iwconfig wlan0 essid "SSID" ; dhclient wlan0 ; /etc/init.d/ipkungfu restart' so no :)
or use network-admin, they should show up there if the SSID's are published.
huh... complicated...  ...with Warty and NetworkManger I was able to just click on the network I wanted to use and *blim* I was in the net
yeah, something more 'on the fly' would be nice as default in ubuntu :)
yep... I guess I'll try to get the NetworkManager running....
i'm sure you know about http://people.ubuntu.com/~thom/network-manager/ right?  but that's the one i couldn't get working
yes that is how I got it running in Warty, plus I had to upgrade wireless-tools. No luck in Hoary though
afaik i tried it the other day in Hoary, no luck here either :(
I think I will try to compile the NetworkManager from source and see how that goes. I'll let you know in a while
interesting... the ./configure complains "configure: error: iwlib.h not found. Install wireless-tools" even though I have wireless-tools installed...
there is way to install source in debian but i have no clue :)
didn't get NetworkManager to work but check out http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=25398
...atleast I got my wlan running with that. Had to a slight modification to the code though
